channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Memcyco Raises $37 Million for Anti-Impersonation Technology
item.description: The startup will use the investment to fuel global expansion of its agentless platform, including in Latin America. The post Memcyco Raises $37 Million for Anti-Impersonation Technology appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Haiku 3.5
item.description: Jan 27, 14:56 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Jan 27, 14:23 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Stratospheric internet could finally start taking off this year
item.description: Today, an estimated 2.2 billion people still have either limited or no access to the internet, largely because they live in remote places. But that number could drop this year, thanks to tests of stratospheric airships, uncrewed aircraft, and other high-altitude platforms for internet...

item.title: ClickFix Attacks Expand Using Fake CAPTCHAs, Microsoft Scripts, and Trusted Web Services
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a new campaign that combines ClickFix-style fake CAPTCHAs with a signed Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) script to distribute an information stealer called Amatera. "Instead of launching PowerShell directly, the attacker uses this...

item.title: The Download: OpenAI’s plans for science, and chatbot age verification
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Inside OpenAI’s big play for science  —Will Douglas Heaven In the three years since ChatGPT’s explosive debut, OpenAI’s technology has upended a...

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Quantum Computing and the Potential Synergy With Advanced AI
item.description: Quantum computers are coming, with a potential computing power almost beyond comprehension. The post Cyber Insights 2026: Quantum Computing and the Potential Synergy With Advanced AI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chrome, Edge Extensions Caught Stealing ChatGPT Sessions
item.description: Marketed as ChatGPT enhancement and productivity tools, the extensions allow the threat actor to access the victim's ChatGPT data. The post Chrome, Edge Extensions Caught Stealing ChatGPT Sessions appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CTEM in Practice: Prioritization, Validation, and Outcomes That Matter
item.description: Cybersecurity teams increasingly want to move beyond looking at threats and vulnerabilities in isolation. It’s not only about what could go wrong (vulnerabilities) or who might attack (threats), but where they intersect in your actual environment to create real, exploitable exposure. Which...

item.title: Elevated Codex Error Rate
item.description: Status: ResolvedAll impacted services have now fully recovered.Affected components Codex (Operational)

item.title: Organizations Warned of Exploited Linux Vulnerabilities
item.description: The flaws allow threat actors to obtain root privileges or bypass authentication via Telnet and gain shell access as root. The post Organizations Warned of Exploited Linux Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical Grist-Core Vulnerability Allows RCE Attacks via Spreadsheet Formulas
item.description: A critical security flaw has been disclosed in Grist‑Core, an open-source, self-hosted version of the Grist relational spreadsheet-database, that could result in remote code execution. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-24002 (CVSS score: 9.1), has been codenamed Cellbreak by Cyera Research...

item.title: Alyah ⭐️: Toward Robust Evaluation of Emirati Dialect Capabilities in Arabic LLMs
China-Linked Hackers Have Used the PeckBirdy JavaScript C2 Framework Since 2023
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a JScript-based command-and-control (C2) framework called PeckBirdy that has been put to use by China-aligned APT actors since 2023 to target multiple environments. The flexible framework has been put to use against Chinese gambling industries and malicious...

item.title: Microsoft Patches Office Zero-Day Likely Exploited in Targeted Attacks
item.description: The vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2026-21509 and it can be exploited to bypass security features. The post Microsoft Patches Office Zero-Day Likely Exploited in Targeted Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Kimi K2.5 Launches Quietly with Upgraded Vision and Tool Integration！
item.description: Kimi quietly launches K2.5, bringing upgraded visual capabilities, tool integration, and agent-style reasoning that set the stage for the next-generation K3 model.

item.title: Alibaba Unveils Qwen3‑Max‑Thinking, Performance Rivaling GPT‑5.2 and Gemini 3 Pro！
item.description: Alibaba launches Qwen3‑Max‑Thinking, a trillion-parameter flagship reasoning model that sets new global records and rivals GPT‑5.2 and Gemini 3 Pro in performance.

item.title: Ant Group Open-Sources LingBot-Depth: Next-Generation Spatial Perception Model Based on Masked Depth Modeling
item.description: Robbyant open-sources LingBot-Depth, a high-precision spatial perception model that transforms noisy depth data into real-scale 3D measurements using masked depth modeling.

item.title: Li Auto Signals Restart of Humanoid Robot Program
item.description: Li Auto confirms plans to develop humanoid robots and aims to strengthen its embodied intelligence brand while targeting a top position in AI and autonomous driving.

item.title: DeepWay Secures $164M Pre‑IPO Financing, Setting Record in Autonomous New Energy Heavy Truck Sector！
item.description: DeepWay has raised $164 million in a record‑breaking Pre‑IPO round to accelerate commercialization of its autonomous new energy heavy truck technology and expand freight operations.

item.title: [AINews] Anthropic launches the MCP Apps open spec, in Claude.ai
item.description: Open Standards for Rich generative UI is all you need.

item.title: Microsoft Office Zero-Day (CVE-2026-21509) - Emergency Patch Issued for Active Exploitation
item.description: Microsoft on Monday issued out-of-band security patches for a high-severity Microsoft Office zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-21509, carries a CVSS score of 7.8 out of 10.0. It has been described as a security feature bypass in Microsoft Office....

item.title: Online parameter estimation for the Crazyflie quadcopter through an EM algorithm
item.description: arXiv:2601.17009v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Drones are becoming more and more popular nowadays. They are small in size, low in cost, and reliable in operation. They contain a variety of sensors and can perform a variety of flight tasks, reaching places that are difficult or inaccessible for...

item.title: Interpreting Agentic Systems: Beyond Model Explanations to System-Level Accountability
item.description: arXiv:2601.17168v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Agentic systems have transformed how Large Language Models (LLMs) can be leveraged to create autonomous systems with goal-directed behaviors, consisting of multi-step planning and the ability to interact with different environments. These systems...

item.title: Implementing Tensor Logic: Unifying Datalog and Neural Reasoning via Tensor Contraction
item.description: arXiv:2601.17188v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The unification of symbolic reasoning and neural networks remains a central challenge in artificial intelligence. Symbolic systems offer reliability and interpretability but lack scalability, while neural networks provide learning capabilities but...

item.title: High-Fidelity Longitudinal Patient Simulation Using Real-World Data
item.description: arXiv:2601.17310v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Simulation is a powerful tool for exploring uncertainty. Its potential in clinical medicine is transformative and includes personalized treatment planning and virtual clinical trials. However, simulating patient trajectories is challenging because of...

item.title: Phase Transition for Budgeted Multi-Agent Synergy
item.description: arXiv:2601.17311v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-agent systems can improve reliability, yet under a fixed inference budget they often help, saturate, or even collapse. We develop a minimal and calibratable theory that predicts these regimes from three binding constraints of modern agent...

item.title: A Cautionary Tale of Self-Supervised Learning for Imaging Biomarkers: Alzheimer's Disease Case Study
item.description: arXiv:2601.16467v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Discovery of sensitive and biologically grounded biomarkers is essential for early detection and monitoring of Alzheimer's disease (AD). Structural MRI is widely available but typically relies on hand-crafted features such as cortical thickness or...

item.title: Robust Categorical Data Clustering Guided by Multi-Granular Competitive Learning
item.description: arXiv:2601.16491v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Data set composed of categorical features is very common in big data analysis tasks. Since categorical features are usually with a limited number of qualitative possible values, the nested granular cluster effect is prevalent in the implicit discrete...

item.title: BoostFGL: Boosting Fairness in Federated Graph Learning
item.description: arXiv:2601.16496v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Federated graph learning (FGL) enables collaborative training of graph neural networks (GNNs) across decentralized subgraphs without exposing raw data. While existing FGL methods often achieve high overall accuracy, we show that this average...

item.title: kNN-Graph: An adaptive graph model for $k$-nearest neighbors
item.description: arXiv:2601.16509v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The k-nearest neighbors (kNN) algorithm is a cornerstone of non-parametric classification in artificial intelligence, yet its deployment in large-scale applications is persistently constrained by the computational trade-off between inference speed and...

item.title: Finite-Time Analysis of Gradient Descent for Shallow Transformers
item.description: arXiv:2601.16514v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Understanding why Transformers perform so well remains challenging due to their non-convex optimization landscape. In this work, we analyze a shallow Transformer with $m$ independent heads trained by projected gradient descent in the kernel regime....

item.title: Crystal-KV: Efficient KV Cache Management for Chain-of-Thought LLMs via Answer-First Principle
item.description: arXiv:2601.16986v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) reasoning in large language models (LLMs) significantly improves accuracy on complex tasks, yet incurs excessive memory overhead due to the long think-stage sequences stored in the Key-Value (KV) cache. Unlike traditional...

item.title: Evaluating Reward Model Generalization via Pairwise Maximum Discrepancy Competitions
item.description: arXiv:2601.16987v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reward models (RMs) are central to aligning large language models, yet their practical effectiveness hinges on generalization to unseen prompts and shifting distributions. Most existing RM evaluations rely on static, pre-annotated preference datasets,...

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification for Named Entity Recognition via Full-Sequence and Subsequence Conformal Prediction
item.description: arXiv:2601.16999v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Named Entity Recognition (NER) serves as a foundational component in many natural language processing (NLP) pipelines. However, current NER models typically output a single predicted label sequence without any accompanying measure of uncertainty,...

item.title: RAM-SD: Retrieval-Augmented Multi-agent framework for Sarcasm Detection
item.description: arXiv:2601.17002v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Sarcasm detection remains a significant challenge due to its reliance on nuanced contextual understanding, world knowledge, and multi-faceted linguistic cues that vary substantially across different sarcastic expressions. Existing approaches, from...

item.title: From Emotion to Expression: Theoretical Foundations and Resources for Fear Speech
item.description: arXiv:2601.17132v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Few forces rival fear in their ability to mobilize societies, distort communication, and reshape collective behavior. In computational linguistics, fear is primarily studied as an emotion, but not as a distinct form of speech. Fear speech content is...

item.title: Inside OpenAI’s big play for science
item.description: In the three years since ChatGPT’s explosive debut, OpenAI’s technology has upended a remarkable range of everyday activities at home, at work, in schools—anywhere people have a browser open or a phone out, which is everywhere. Now OpenAI is making an explicit play for scientists. In October, the...

item.title: Why chatbots are starting to check your age
item.description: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here. How do tech companies check if their users are kids? This question has taken on new urgency recently thanks to growing concern about the dangers that can arise...

item.title: Who Operates the Badbox 2.0 Botnet?
item.description: The cybercriminals in control of Kimwolf -- a disruptive botnet that has infected more than 2 million devices -- recently shared a screenshot indicating they'd compromised the control panel for Badbox 2.0, a vast China-based botnet powered by malicious software that comes pre-installed on many...

item.title: **NVIDIA Earth-2 Open Models Span the Whole Weather Stack**
The power of sound in a virtual world
item.description: In an era where business, education, and even casual conversations occur via screens, sound has become a differentiating factor. We obsess over lighting, camera angles, and virtual backgrounds, but how we sound can be just as critical to credibility, trust, and connection. That’s the insight...

item.title: UI Remix: Supporting UI Design Through Interactive Example Retrieval and Remixing
item.description: Designing user interfaces (UIs) is a critical step when launching products, building portfolios, or personalizing projects, yet end users without design expertise often struggle to articulate their intent and to trust design choices. Existing example-based tools either promote broad exploration,...

item.title: One Adapts to Any: Meta Reward Modeling for Personalized LLM Alignment
item.description: Alignment of Large Language Models (LLMs) aims to align outputs with human preferences, and personalized alignment further adapts models to individual users. This relies on personalized reward models that capture user-specific preferences and automatically provide individualized feedback. However,...

item.title: Self-Refining Video Sampling
item.description: Modern video generators still struggle with complex physical dynamics, often falling short of physical realism. Existing approaches address this using external verifiers or additional training on augmented data, which is computationally expensive and still limited in capturing fine-grained motion....

item.title: daVinci-Dev: Agent-native Mid-training for Software Engineering
item.description: Recently, the frontier of Large Language Model (LLM) capabilities has shifted from single-turn code generation to agentic software engineering-a paradigm where models autonomously navigate, edit, and test complex repositories. While post-training methods have become the de facto approach for code...

item.title: SAGE: Steerable Agentic Data Generation for Deep Search with Execution Feedback
item.description: Deep search agents, which aim to answer complex questions requiring reasoning across multiple documents, can significantly speed up the information-seeking process. Collecting human annotations for this application is prohibitively expensive due to long and complex exploration trajectories. We...
